main event: A high-ranking Air Force officer reported seeing a glowing, maneuverable object in the sky over Dhahran, Saudi Arabia on April 19, 1952.
interesting points: The object exhibited rapid, erratic movements, including sharp 90-degree turns, at an estimated speed in excess of 3,000 mph.
The object's performance was described as completely foreign to the officer's experience and in violation of the laws of aerodynamics.
The officer was initially skeptical of such reports but became convinced this was a genuine unidentified flying object.
The sighting lasted for 5-6 seconds and the object approached the officer's estimated visual limit of 3 miles before reversing course.
The report was forwarded to the Director of Intelligence at the Department of the Air Force for review.
sighted object: a glowing, bluish object that exhibited rapid, erratic movements
